posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
Hail, ECBers!

I know it's a little unfair to be posting Aribeth close to the end, as she's quite the plot character in the series. She becomes a Henchwoman only in Chapter 3 of HoTU, but you know very well of her story. She was a zealot, a paladin so bent on destroying evil that she became evil herself, at least for a while, then she atoned for her sins later on and was forgiven by Tyr, regaining her Paladin abilities. To me, that one-dimensional and strict view of good and evil is only representable by making her a Smiter. She feels so strongly about things that she becomes an evil-hunting machine, but then when good people, like Lord Nasher, do something stupid, she smites them as well (albeit with much less violent force). She has the most amazing saves a character can have, but no evasion, and she can kill any evil thing with her first two attacks, but against everything else, she's just an average warrior, meaning that when her blood isn't boiling with rage, she will have quite a low AB, but good ways of buffing it. Her AB is 36 +6 from capped STR (gear and two stacking Bull's Strength spells), +5 GMW +5 Divine Favor +1 Aid +1 Bless +1 Prayer. She can reach 55 AB fully beefed up, and once per day she can cast Divine Wrath for another +5 to AB and damage. Still, depending on the world, she should have enough AB to hit just about any mobs, and the ability to quickly dispatch evil bosses. Her most notorious trouble will come against Neutral Bosses, because then she will be severely handicapped, so to deal with those situations, a maxed-out Taunt skill comes into play. Cross-class Tumble AC isn't a problem, because she's a CHA-focused paladin with DIvine Shield and Expertise.

Oh, yeah, and just in case you're wondering, there are two alignment changes required in this build. That is also another reason why I left her for later on. She is going to be illegal in many servers, including on WoG, where I play, so I made an alternative version of her to be played on those servers, which I shall post below. Also, Champion of Tyr is Champion of Torm in-game, just in case.

posts.content: Human? I know it doesn't work out as nicely (XP penalty-wise) for the second build, but it seems line Aribeth has to be an elf (or half-elf, if one takes the HotU slip-up as cannon).

posts.author: Maximillian Kane
posts.content:
MrZork wrote:Human? I know it doesn't work out as nicely (XP penalty-wise) for the second build, but it seems line Aribeth has to be an elf (or half-elf, if one takes the HotU slip-up as cannon).
True, since Bioware didn't decide on her race, I thought I'd have poetic license to choose whichever one most appealed to me. You may drop Expertise and Concentration if you want to be a Half Elf
